title: Script Debugger Retired
author: John Gruber
excerpt: The day has finally come. After 30 years of continuous development, Script Debugger has been retired and will no longer be available for sale.
text: The day has finally come. After 30 years of continuous development, Script Debugger has been retired and will no longer be available for sale. Please see this post for more information. Thank You! Over the last few months we have received a wonderful outpouring of well wishes and stories from our customers describing how Script Debugger has helped them over the years, via email and on our forum. Shane and I want to express our deepest gratitude for your kind words and memories. It has been a privilege to contribute to the Macintosh software community. Downloads Script Debugger is now a free download. Links to all versions of Script Debugger from 8.0 to 4.0, along with registration numbers, are available on the Downloads page. These free versions of Script Debugger are provided AS-IS and without warranty, maintenance or support. Those seeking a version of Script Debugger for the Classic MacOS should go here. Post navigation The home of Script Debugger
html:
The day has finally come. After 30 years of continuous development, Script Debugger has been retired and will no longer be available for sale. Please see this post for more information.

Thank You!

Over the last few months we have received a wonderful outpouring of well wishes and stories from our customers describing how Script Debugger has helped them over the years, via email and on our forum.

Shane and I want to express our deepest gratitude for your kind words and memories. It has been a privilege to contribute to the Macintosh software community.

Downloads

Script Debugger is now a free download.

Links to all versions of Script Debugger from 8.0 to 4.0, along with registration numbers, are available on the Downloads page. These free versions of Script Debugger are provided AS-IS and without warranty, maintenance or support.

Those seeking a version of Script Debugger for the Classic MacOS should go here.
